edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.device
Class Tile

java.lang.Object
  edu.byu.ece.rapidSmith.device.Tile
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class represents the same information found and described in XDLRC files concerning Xilinx FPGA tiles. The representation given by XDLRC files is that every FPGA is described as a 2D array of Tiles, each with a set of primitive sites, and hence sources, sinks and wires to connect tiles together and wires within.

Author:
Chris Lavin Created on: Apr 22, 2010
See Also:

          Allows Serializable functionality
private  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,SinkPin> sinks
          This is a list of the sinks within the tile (generally in the primitives)

          This is a list of the sources within the tile (generally in the primitives)
private  int tileXCoordinate
          This is the X coordinate in the tile name (ex: 0 in INT_X0Y5)
private  int tileYCoordinate
          This is the Y coordinate in the tile name (ex: 5 in INT_X0Y5)
private  TileType type
          XDL Tile Type (INT,CLB,...)
private  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Wire[]> wires
          This variable holds all the wires and their connections within the tile

Method Detail

getSinks

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,SinkPin> getSinks()
Gets and returns the HashMap containing the sinks for this tile. The keys are the actual sink wires and the values are the SinkPin objects.

Returns:
The HashMap of sink wire mappings in this tile.

setSinks

public void setSinks(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,SinkPin> sinks)
This is used to populate the tile sinks and should probably not be called during normal usage.

Parameters:
sinks - The new sinks to set for this tile.

getSources

public int[] getSources()
Gets and returns the sources of all the primitive sites in this tile.

Returns:
The source wires found in this tile.

setSources

public void setSources(int[] sources)
This is used to populate the tile sources and should probably not be called during normal usage.

Parameters:
sources - The new sources to set for this tile.

getWires

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Wire[]> getWires()
Gets and returns the wires HashMap for this tile.

Returns:
The wires HashMap for this tile.

getWireConnections

public Wire[] getWireConnections(int wire)
This will get all of the wire connections that can be made from the given wire in this tile.

Parameters:
wire - A wire in this tile to query its potential connections.
Returns:
An array of wires which connect to the given wire.

setWires

public void setWires(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Wire[]> wires)
This is used to populate the tile wires and should probably not be called during normal usage.

Parameters:
wires - The new wires to set for this tile.

setPrimitiveSites

public void setPrimitiveSites(PrimitiveSite[] primitiveSites)
Sets the primitive sites present in this tile, should not be called during normal usage.

Parameters:
primitiveSites - The new primitive sites.

getPrimitiveSites

public PrimitiveSite[] getPrimitiveSites()
Gets and returns the primitive site array for this tile.

Returns:
An array of primitive sites present in this tile.

addSink

public void addSink(int sink)
Used to compile the sinks for this tile during parsing, should not be called during normal usage.

Parameters:
sink - The new sink to add. The SinkPin created is initialized to -1,0.

addSource

public void addSource(int source)
Used to compile the sources for this tile during parsing, should not be called during normal usage.

Parameters:
source - The new source to add.

addConnection

public void addConnection(int src,
                          Wire dest)
This method adds a key/value pair to the wires HashMap.

Parameters:
src - The wire (or key) of the HashMap to add.
dest - The actual wire to add to the value or Wire[] in the HashMap.

getUniqueAddress

public int getUniqueAddress(Device dev)
Gets a unique integer address for this tile (useful for representing a tile as a single integer).

Parameters:
dev - The device this tile belongs to.
Returns:
The unique integer address of this tile in the device dev.

getTileYCoordinate

public int getTileYCoordinate()
This is the Y Coordinate in the tile name (the 5 in INT_X0Y5)

Returns:
the tileRow

getTileXCoordinate

public int getTileXCoordinate()
This is the X Coordinate in the tile name (the 0 in INT_X0Y5)

Returns:
the tileColumn

getPIPs

public java.util.ArrayList<PIP> getPIPs()
This method will create a new list of PIPs from those existing in the instance of this Tile object. Use this method with caution as it will generate a lot of new PIPs each time it is called which may (or may not) use a lot of memory.

Returns:
A list of all PIPs in this tile.

getManhattanDistance

public int getManhattanDistance(Tile tile)
Calculates the Manhattan distance between this tile and the given tile. It calculates the distance based on tileXCoordinate and tileYCoordinate rather than the absolute indices of the tile.

Parameters:
tile - The tile to compare against.
Returns:
The integer Manhattan distance between this and the given tile.
